Child Safety Standards Officer

Company Name Hobsons Bay City Council Company Location Hobsons Bay, AU

New Posted Date Posted 23 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Child Safety Standards Officer

Fixed Term Part Time - 3 days per week (22.8 hours ) - 6 month contract

Band 6 - $84,497 - $92,100 pro rata (+ 9.5% super)

Hobsons Bay City Council is currently seeking an experienced early year’s specialist committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children to fill the position of Child Safety Standards Officer.

In this role you will be responsible for the identification and implementation of appropriate programs to support the Council in ensuring compliance with the Child Safety Standards and other child safety legislation. The role will have a focus on risk management and partnering with relevant stakeholders to child safety. You will be required to build strong partnerships and relationships across all levels of council management and other internal stakeholders. Working as part of the Organisation Development team the role will report to the Manager Organisation Development and work closely with the Coordinator Learning and Development and other specialists across the organisation. You will have a natural manner with people, uphold Councils values and enjoy working in a role where you can truly make a difference.

You Will Have
  • a Bachelor of Early Childhood Education or equivalent qualification as approved by the Australian Children’s Education and Care Quality Authority (ACECQA)
  • demonstrated understanding of and commitment to the Victorian Child Safety Standards
  • demonstrated experience in the management of large projects with many stakeholders
  • excellent interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to develop and maintain constructive working relationships at all levels of the organisation to gain cooperation, influence stakeholders and achieve positive results.
  • demonstrated extensive experience in the development of polices and procedure associated the protection of children

A position description can be obtained through Customer Focus team on 9932 1000 or by using the download feature below. For further information please contact Terri Rowe, Manager Organisation Development on 9932 1000.

The successful applicant will need to hold a valid Working With Children Check card.

Applications must include a statement addressing the selection criteria and close Sunday 30 September 2018.

Please submit your application either by submitting online or posting to:

HR Recruitment
Hobsons Bay City Council
PO Box 21
ALTONA VIC 3018

An automated email will be sent upon receipt of your electronic application. Please re-submit your application if the auto reply has not been received or call (03) 9932 1092 if you are experiencing difficulty.

Hobsons Bay City Council is committed to the principles of Equal Opportunity and workplace diversity. We encourage a diverse workforce reflective of our community to better meet the needs of our customers.

Your Career is our Success

Professor/SHARP - School of Accounting

Company Name UNSW Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 15 views

Job description

Professor / SHARP

School of Accounting , UNSW Business School
  • One of Australia’s leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

UNSW Business School is a leader in business education and research in the Asian region and one of the largest Business Schools in Australia with more than 15,000 students, 500 academic and professional staff and more than 80,000 alumni and partners. The Business School offers a full suite of business degree programs at undergraduate, postgraduate, coursework and research levels, including the AGSM MBA programs and a range of Executive Programs. Its direction is guided by a business advisory council of leading CEOs, chairpersons and other business leaders.

The School of Accounting is internationally renowned for its innovative research in several published rankings. It is seen by many as the top accounting research institution in Australia and one of the premier Schools in the Asian Pacific region. The School of Accounting is also known for its high-quality teaching at both undergraduate and graduate levels.

About The Role
  • Academic Level E – a competitive salary will be offered
  • Continuing position, 35 hours per week
  • Based at Kensington, Sydney

Applications are invited for the appointment of a Professor/SHARP (Level E academic) with an outstanding record of research and scholarship and demonstrated leadership and research expertise in Accounting.

A Level E Academic (Professor) is expected to make high-level contributions to research, teaching, and internal and external engagement in the School and to carry out activities to maintain and develop his/her scholarly research and professional activities.

The Professor will also pursue and develop a highly active and productive research program at the highest levels (i.e. publications in top refereed Accounting and related journals, research grant applications, research student supervision, presentation to conferences and publications in conference proceedings).

To Be Successful In This Role You Will Have

About the successful applicant
  • A PhD degree in Accounting
  • An excellent record of high quality in publications in the leading Accounting journals
  • Record of outstanding achievement in providing leadership in a managerial role in a University or professional setting and of outstanding contribution within these settings;
  • Record of outstanding achievement in providing leadership in a managerial role in a University or professional or scholarly setting and of outstanding contribution within these settings;
  • A record of academic excellence with an outstanding contribution to teaching and research at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels including MBA
  • Capacity and experience to play a leadership role in the development of research, teaching and programs relevant to the discipline area and needs of the Business School
  • A strong demonstrated ability for teaching and curriculum development at both the undergraduate and postgraduate level including MBA and a willingness to assist with the development of courses and program review
  • Proven ability to supervise honours and postgraduate research students
  • Demonstrated ability to contribute to the research agenda of the School and a willingness to develop ARC Linkage Grants and competitive grant funding

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application. Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

Company Name EnergyAustralia Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 23 views

Job description

About the Team


The Energy Trading team is responsible for developing, maintaining and executing all EnergyAustralia’s electricity, gas, coal and carbon hedging strategies.


The Analysis Team is responsible for managing, enhancing and extending EnergyAustralia’s electricity and gas wholesale market analyses and modelling capabilities to ensure that planning, trading, strategy, and policy decisions are informed by an in depth understanding of and insight into market drivers and directions.


About Us


EnergyAustralia is a highly regarded and progressive energy retailer. We provide smart, innovative energy solutions for over 1.7 million customers. We’re excited about the amazing things energy can do. And we’re determined to drive positive change. Our passion is to empower and energise Australians towards better energy use.


About the role


The Market Analyst role will be responsible for undertaking analysis across the electricity, gas and renewable energy wholesale markets to support trading decision-making and strategic regulatory and policy decisions.


This role will also take the lead in managing and enhancing our short-term electricity market modelling capability, ensuring the model incorporates current market behaviours and planned market and system changes.You will also exploit publicly available data regarding the wholesale energy and renewable markets to complement your analysis and draw insights for Energy Trading.


What we’re looking for:


  • Demonstrated analytical or commercial experience in the energy sector.
  • Knowledge of electricity and gas wholesale markets.
  • Experience in operating complex modelling applications and handling large data sets.
  • Strong skills in Tableau, SQL, VBA and Excel.
  • Proven solving capability, conceptual thinker and ability to communicate findings clearly.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, having the ability to speak to both technical and non-technical stakeholder groups.

How to Apply:


If you share our passion for making customers a priority, doing the right thing, leading change and want to be part of an organisation focused on making a positive impact, click the 'Apply" button to submit your application.


For a confidential discussion, please contact Aoife O’Hagan on email Aoife.O'Hagan@energyaustralia.com.au.


\xa0

Data Analyst

We are EA! And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That's why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry!

The Studio
Electronic Arts’ Firemonkeys Studio in Melbourne is highly regarded throughout the industry as a leader in delivering high quality, engaging games on iOS and Android. We release new meaningful updates on a regular basis for our live mobile games such as Real Racing 3, The Sims FreePlay, Need for Speed, and many more.

The Challenge Ahead
As a Data Analyst with EA Melbourne's Quality Verification team, you will play a key role in analysing our operational data to support continuous improvements in our Quality Verification strategies. Senior DevOps Engineer

Company Name UniSuper Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

UniSuper is a multiple award winning superannuation funds with over $65 billion worth of funds under management. Employing over 750 employees across Australia and headquartered here in Melbourne we are more than just your regular superannuation company.

Our technology business unit is one of our proudest features with over 250 talented IT professionals.

What You Will Be Doing

The purpose of the role is to design, document, implement and maintain robust automation solutions that support the adoption of DevOps principles within UniSuper, with a focus on building to a self-service model supporting continuous integration and continuous delivery.

Other key responsibilities include;

  • Design, build and document our automation framework(s) including provisioning, configuration, monitoring, maintenance, testing and deployment to support the USM’s move to a self-service model
  • Ensure all artefacts are built to provide quality, security, scalability, stability, efficiency, reliability while ensuring compliance with USM governing standards.
  • Automate and regularly review/optimise our CI/CD processes and tools.
  • Work closely with the various business and technology enablement teams to brainstorm, design and build technical continuous delivery solutions
  • Willingness to cross skill, learn new technology and share learnings with the business and technology enablement teams to ensure the overall success of technology.

    • What We Are Looking For

    You will be an experienced Platform/System/DevOps/Cloud engineer with proven scripting and programming experience that conforms to good software engineering design principles and practices.

    Ideally you will enjoy coaching, part of this role will involve embedding the practice into the delivery teams here and the teams are very open to learn new skills.

    Other technical skills that would be critical to success include;
    • Deployment automation tools such as vRA/vRO, Docker, Puppet, Ansible, DSC
    • Proficient in one or more scripting languages like PowerShell, MS Build, BAT, Python or C#
    • Source code management tools such as Bitbucket or GIT
    • Continuous integration tools like Bamboo or Jenkins
    • Exposure to Azure and AWS Paas
    • Experience in .NET, BizTalk, WCF, SQL Server 2012+, Web and Integration technologies.

    Benefits And Culture

    At UniSuper we are proud of our fantastic company culture and genuine work/life balance. Our staff wellbeing program includes seated massages, local gym discounts, social events and volunteering opportunities.

    Our offices boast fantastic views of the Yarra River and have secure bike parking and shower/changes facilities within. We also have a dedicated learning and development department to support your ongoing needs with regular lunch and learns and access to technical training and e-learning where required to support you in your role and career aspirations.

Job description

Broadsheet is looking for a creative and strategic leader to oversee the execution of all our branded content and respond to pitches with innovative ideas. You will work closely with Broadsheet Studio’s account director to lead the team to produce our best work and ensure financial success.


Reporting to the Commercial Director, this role requires creative thinking, sound business acumen and strategic problem solving. You will have the opportunity to work with some of Australia’s most highly respected brands in this exciting role at one of the nation’s leading publishers.


While this is a leadership role, you will also need to get your hands dirty responding to pitches within a short timeframe yourself. The Broadsheet Studio team is nimble and requires everyone within the team to contribute to ensure successful campaign outcomes.


The Director of Branded Content will have three direct reports within the Broadsheet Studio team.


In this role you will:


- Play a leadership role within the studio including inspiring the team, maintaining our vision and upholding our standards


- Develop content ideas spanning articles, videos and events


- Respond to pitches with creative and financially achievable concepts in a timely manner


- Work closely with the national sales team to ensure pitch responses are on-brand for Broadsheet and will deliver results for brands we work with


- Oversee the roll-out of branded projects from inception to final reporting


- Work closely with the Broadsheet Studio editors to bring to life articles and photography


- Work closely with the Broadsheet Studio video team to bring to life branded videos


- Work closely with the wider studio team to develop and execute branded events and larger branded projects


- Work closely with the social media team to ensure our branded content is distributed effectively


- Maintain the Broadsheet brand in all branded partnerships


- Adjust campaign strategies on-the-fly to ensure the best results


- Oversee all campaign reports


- Be a voice for Broadsheet Studio at industry and internal events


- Regularly attend client meetings and sales meetings



We are looking for applicants who meet the following criteria:


- Sound leadership capabilities including engaging people to achieve their personal goals and goals for the wider business


- Significant experience working with multiple brands at once

- The ability to apply a creative and strategic mindset to solve problems


- Experience in a high-pressure, fast-turnaround environment, juggling many tasks at once


- Strong written and verbal communication skills


- A team-player mindset


- The ability to work autonomously and make quick decisions


- Experience in publishing and creating content for a specific audience


- An understanding of the Broadsheet brand


- A genuine interest in arts and culture


Please submit your application including a cover letter, resume and your favourite example of best-in-market branded content, with an explanation of why it works to studio_jobs@broadsheet.com.au.


Applications close Tuesday September 18. We will be conducting interviews before this date so please don’t delay submitting your application.

Company Name Bardot Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 287 views

Job description

OUR BRAND

Driven by innovation and achieving results, and established in 1996 the Australian owned Bardot, has quickly become a leading fashion retailer, specialising in womens and childrenswear. We are a fast paced business with over 1,000 employees, and over 95 stores across Australia. With a continued focus on international and national expansion, Bardot is looking to add a high performing individuals to assist in our growth plans.

OUR VALUES

Your role will also be to embody and promote the Bardot Core Values in everything you do. As a business we value and promote behaviours that encompass:

  • Integrity
  • Excellence
  • Passion
  • Customer First
  • Knowledge

THE ROLE

The role of the Marketing Communications Manager is responsible for the development, execution, and supervision of both marketing campaigns, strategic initiatives and day-to-day public and media relations activities, along with influencer management.

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Brand /Marketing Communications

  • Concept and drive the marketing campaigns and shoots from inception to delivery based on ranges, promotional activity and key trend events in conjunction with the Photography & Studio Manager and Creative Director
  • Work to ensure calendar, current events and seasonal trends are taken into consideration to effectively and proactively contribute to story angle, maximising product placement and brand features
  • Ensure brand consistency globally across all brand touchpoints (Retail, VM, Online, Studio, Graphic Design and Social).
  • Coordinate objectives and briefing of marketing campaigns with Marketing, Studio, VM, Online, Retail and Design Departments.
  • Enhance PR and Social agencies and influencer partnerships.
  • Manage the budget spend across PR, Social and Marketing
  • Manage, coordinate and develop the communications coordinator and graphic designers

Digital - Social

  • Derive and execute the global strategy for social across Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat & Pinterest to define appropriate approach in different markets by social platform
  • Develop the affiliate content strategy with the aim of recruiting new content partners and delivering sales volume
  • Develop and manage any social competitions to drive brand engagement and following
  • Devise and maintain a system of metrics to measure effectiveness, reach and conversion of PR and social activity; through engagement, industry and competitor actives with weekly and monthly reporting

Events

  • Management and coordination of events that places our brands at the forefront of consumers including launch parties, runway and press showings/events
  • Develop and execute Bardot Press Event to build brand awareness, through key launches throughout the year - from venue hire, invitation creation, hosting and follow up; a complete 360 execution.
  • Manage any internal corporate events as required

To be considered for this role, you will ideally:

  • 2-3 years of experience as a Marketing Communications Manager
  • Experience working in fashion apparel is a must
  • Ideally some international experience
  • Sound knowledge of social media platforms
  • Degree in Marketing
  • Strong relationship building with key internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong communication skills with a high attention to detail
  • Must be creative and have an eye for detail

In return we offer:

  • A great salary package and location
  • Staff discounts - 40% off Bardot and Bardot Junior product
  • Job satisfaction by being empowered to make a difference
  • A great culture with an opportunity to have fun at work
  • Recognition and reward for a job well done

Bardot as an Employer:

Bardot believes we should all be measured in terms of the passion we bring to our workplace, our emphasis on placing the customer first, and the integrity with which we approach our career, and our commitment to expanding our knowledge, and to excellence in everything we do. If this rings true, make sure you GET OUT THERE! APPLY NOW!

Job description

About The Role
  • Part Time 24 – 32 hours per week, 52 weeks Fixed Term, commencing February 2019
  • Perioperative Services, Mercy Hospital for Women
  • Provide both experience and tertiary qualification within the perioperative environment
  • Conducted in conjunction with Deakin University
  • Provides clinically based experiences in Gynaecology, Uro-gynaecology, Gynae-oncology, Reproductive Medicine, Endo-surgery, Obstetrics, Anaesthetics, Post Anaesthetic and Day Surgery nursing that compliments the theoretical education
About You
  • 12-months relevant acute nursing experience prior to commencement – prior perioperative highly experience desirable
  • Current AHPRA registration as a Registered Nurse
  • Demonstrated commitment and responsibility for ongoing own professional development
  • Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills that supports cohesive and collaborative teamwork
  • Demonstrated patient-focused approach to providing quality perioperative nursing care
About Us

Mercy Hospital for Women is a fully accredited Level 6 Public Specialist Teaching Hospital providing both public and private patient care through maternity services, neonatology and paediatrics, perioperative services, gynaecology, women’s health and associated health, support and diagnostic services. We are a major teaching hospital and specialist referral centre with the medical, nursing, midwifery and allied health expertise to treat the most complex obstetric, neonatal and gynaecological cases.

Mercy Health is a Catholic organisation employing over 8500 people who provide compassionate and holistic care through our acute hospitals, aged care facilities, mental health programs, palliative and respite services, maternity and women’s health services, early parenting services and home care services.

Mercy Health is proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the WGEA.

  • Stepping Stones – our flexibility framework supporting your growth and work life balance
  • Fully funded childcare referral service
To find out more about these exciting initiatives, please visit Mercy Health Careers homepage (http//careers.mercy.com.au/)

At Mercy Health we pride ourselves on embracing diversity and foster an inclusive culture where individual differences are respected and celebrated. We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities and cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Senior Advisor People and Culture


State Government Department


Location: Melbourne CBD


Salary: $116,863- $ 156,387 + super




This core Government department is looking for an experienced and professional Senior HR advisor to work on some of the most integral, interesting and impactful projects in state Government. The successful candidate will have a problem solving mentality and will be willing to assist in any way they can in a fast paced and dynamic environment focused on delivery and assisting with key strategy.


Join a well-resourced, supportive, diverse, inclusive and high performing team and make a real impact, observing real outcomes of your work across the public sector. This close knit team is well respected and sought after across the business. This role will be a key part of the People and Culture leadership team.


The role reporting into the Head of People and Culture will work directly alongside them acting as a 2IC without having any managerial responsibilities or direct reports. The role will deliver and manage high quality HR initiatives that build people capability across the department and the public sector and enhance organisational culture. The ideal candidate will be able to build meaningful and influential relationships with key stakeholders and support any key and highly confidential projects the leadership team will be working on.

  • Demonstrated experience across the full range of HR generalist accountabilities
  • Proven ability to build meaningful relationships with and influence key stakeholders
  • Experience providing sounds, accurate and timely advice to managers, including coaching and mentoring
  • High level written and verbal communication skills


Qualifications

  • A qualification in a relevant field would be desirable


The ideal candidate for this role will have had exposure to the public sector, however this is not mandatory.

Senior Software Engineer

Company Name SolarPlus design and sales software Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Opportunity for resourceful software engineer to lead a proven solar & storage modelling/sales platform as it expands. Brilliant role, passionate team


  • Work from home or come to the office – you choose!
  • Job security with an ongoing, full time position
  • Take ownership, showcase and develop your skills

About the business

Solaris has been developing solar software for 6 years, with the benefit of decades of renewable industry knowledge within the team. Our software, SolarPlus, is the industry-standard design and sales platform in Australia and at the forefront globally in solar and storage modelling.

We offer brilliant opportunities to advance the careers of our staff with a leading product in a fast-growing industry.


The role

Due to business and industry growth, we have created a new opportunity for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team and continue to evolve our solar business platform with leading technologies. Make this role your own.

Our Senior Software Engineer will:

  • Define software requirements
  • Take the lead on operational and technical implementation
  • Be across current technologies and agile methodologies
  • Develop high-quality software that is aligned with user needs and business goals

This position includes great scope for a creative problem-solver to innovate and extend on a powerful modelling platform and make it a thing of beauty.


What You'll Bring

In this role, you will be empowered to work independently, so experience in a consulting or standalone environment would be ideal. You will utilise your skills and drive to meet deadlines and problem solve.

You will also bring:

  • Experience as a Senior Software Engineer
  • Extensive experience in software development, scripting and project management
  • Experience using system monitoring tools and automated testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of selected programming languages (e.g. PHP, Javascript) and MVC frameworks, node.js an advantage
  • In-depth knowledge of relational databases (MySQL)
  • Familiarity with Linux operating systems
  • Analytical mind
  • Excellent organisational and leadership skills
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science or a related degree or proven equivalent experience.

A passion for solar and renewable energy, and/or experience in the industry, will be highly regarded.



For you

We'll offer your flexible working arrangements, so you can work from home or come and spend some time in inner Melbourne or Healesville offices. Your salary package will include an allowance for home internet and required software. We support each other and have a real passion to succeed, so if that sounds like the type of environment that appeals to you, please apply now.
